result.execSummary:
The defendant Alberto M Rodriguez III was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant to undergo domestic abuse counseling, undergo anger management counseling, defendant to submit DNA Sample

Defendant Alberto M Rodriguez in court, in custody with attorney Ronald Gabriel Benavides.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Counsel has received revocation summary, Court sentences defendant to: 16 CM 164, Ct. 2, 1 year jail w/Huber, concurrent, any unpaid court obligations to be converted into civil judgment, 16 CM 42, Ct. 1, 9 months jail w/Huber, concurrent, 207 days sentence credit, any unpaid court obligations to be converted into civil judgment
